attributes.action: Change the working week to 4 days as per trial in Japan, Iceland, Netherlands
attributes.additional_details:
After these countries trialing a 4 day week, Employees felt the difference by

BURNOUT
39% LESS STRESS

Better mental and physical health – more time to focus on our health and wellbeing, and prevent and address any issues or illnesses and spending time with family and friends more. A space to boost tourism and increase productivity. 

Family is so important for everyone and we need to take care and enjoy the time with our loved ones.
attributes.background: Change the working week across all companies with an idea of full time employees working 10 hour shift over 4 days to qualify for the time off or part time employees 6.5 hours over 4 days but no specific days or shift pattern for emergency workers or on call staff.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. UK law places limits on the total amount of time someone can work during a week and the minimum amount they can be paid an hour, but it doesn't specify how many or which days of the week they have to work. This would be a decision for employers and employees.

We could accept a petition calling for the maximum number of hours worked during a week to be reduced, if this is something you would like to see happen.
